meanings.definition: The quality or state of being immovable.
meanings.sent1: The immovablenesses of the mountain range made it impossible to relocate.
meanings.sent2: The ancient castle's immovablenesses impressed visitors with its grandeur.
meanings.sent3: The immovablenesses of the stubborn mule led to a comical standoff with its owner.
meanings.sent4: Her loyalty to her principles was as unyielding as the immovablenesses of a stone statue.
meanings.sent5: The immovablenesses of the massive boulder in the path blocked any progress.

meanings.definition: The inability to be moved or changed.
meanings.sent1: Despite his efforts, the immovablenesses of the heavy rock prevented him from pushing it.
meanings.sent2: The immovablenesses of tradition sometimes hinder progress.
meanings.sent3: The immovablenesses of the old tree stump made it a favorite spot for the neighborhood squirrels.
meanings.sent4: The immovablenesses of time eventually caught up with even the most resistant of structures.
meanings.sent5: The immovablenesses of her decision surprised everyone with its unwavering nature.
